Uses of Drawable in hex
 

Classes in hex that implement Drawable
 class hexCell
          specialized cell used for the game hex, not for all games using a hex board.
 class hexChip
          this is a specialization of chip to represent the stones used by hex; and also other tiles, borders and other images that are used to draw the board.
 

Uses of Drawable in lib
 

Classes in lib that implement Drawable
 class DrawableImage<T>
          DrawableImage is an extension on Image, with support for loading, masking, scaling and displaying the images.
 class HorizontalBar
          a simple drawable bar, intended to be embedded in a text glyph
 class MultiGlyph
          a container to contain multiple glyphs which implement Drawable, and draw them as one.
 

Fields in lib declared as Drawable
 Drawable HitPoint.arrow
          when the mouse is determined to be pointing at something that can be picked up or dropped, set this to a piece of StockArt to be displayed.

Uses of Drawable in online.game
 

Classes in online.game that implement Drawable
 class ccell<FINALTYPE extends ccell<FINALTYPE>>
          some legacy or simple games use just a "char" to indicate the contents of the cell.
 class cell<FINALTYPE extends cell<FINALTYPE>>
          this is the common cell which can be used by all boards.
 class chip<T>
          this is the base class for "chips" which are objects typically placed on boards.
 class chipCell<FINALTYPE extends chipCell<FINALTYPE,COMPONENTTYPE>,COMPONENTTYPE extends chip<?>>
          this is the principal subclass of cell for cells whose contents is just a single object.
 class stackCell<FINALTYPE extends stackCell<FINALTYPE,COMPONENTTYPE>,COMPONENTTYPE extends chip<?>>
          stackCell extends cell with a stack of chips.
 

Methods in online.game that return Drawable
 Drawable stackCell.animationChip(int depth)
          this is used only by animations to get the chip at depth from the top.
 Drawable cell.animationChip(int depth)
          this is used only by animations to get the chip at depth from the top.
